text:
Sin Nombre is a 2009 Mexican-American adventure thriller film written and directed by Cary Joji Fukunaga, about a Honduran girl trying to immigrate to the U.S.A., and a boy caught up in the violence of gang life.
Filmed in Spanish, the title translates as "Nameless". It won awards for directing and cinematography at the 2009 Sundance Film Festival.
